DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text used to describe process by which an assay is identified and handled.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A method of measuring the effects of a biologically active substance using an intermediate in vivo or in vitro tissue or cell model under controlled conditions. (from MSH98)_A statistical technique used to determine which variables discriminate between two or more naturally groups and to determine whether groups differ with regard to the mean of a variable.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A laboratory test/analysis of biological activity of a substance by studying its effect on an organism or in test tube under controlled conditions.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test or analysis of the biological activity of a substance performed by studying its effect on an organism or in a test tube under controlled conditions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statistical technique used to determine which variables discriminate between two or more naturally groups and to determine whether groups differ with regard to the mean of a variable.

Concepts.definition: A statistical technique used to determine which variables discriminate between two or more naturally groups and to determine whether groups differ with regard to the mean of a variable.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The text used to describe process by which an artifact is identified.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A method of measuring the effects of a biologically active substance using an intermediate in vivo or in vitro tissue or cell model under controlled conditions. (from MSH98):A structure or appearance that is not naturally present, but has been introduced though manipulation.:process by which an individual unconsciously endeavors to pattern himself after another; this process is also important in the development of the personality, particularly the superego or conscience, which is modeled largely on the behavior of adult significant others.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test or analysis of the biological activity of a substance performed by studying its effect on an organism or in a test tube under controlled conditions.
A structure or appearance that is not naturally present, but has been introduced though manipulation.

process by which an individual unconsciously endeavors to pattern himself after another; this process is also important in the development of the personality, particularly the superego or conscience, which is modeled largely on the behavior of adult significant others.
